text.0: the gods have not ordained hunger to be our death even to the wellfed man comes death in varied shape.
text.1: the riches of the liberal never waste away while he who will not give finds none to comfort him.
text.2: the man with food in store who when the needy comes in miserable case begging for bread to eat.
text.3: hardens his heart against himeven when of old he did him servicefinds not one to comfort him.
text.4: bounteous is he who gives unto the beggar who comes to him in want of food and feeble.
text.5: success attends him in the shout of battle he makes a friend of him in future troubles.
text.6: no friend is he who to his friend and comrade who comes imploring food will offer nothing.
text.7: let him departno home is that to rest in and rather seek a stranger to support him.
text.8: let the rich satisfy the poor implorer and bend his eye upon a longer pathway.
text.9: riches come now to one now to another and like the wheels of cars are ever rolling.
text.10: the foolish man wins food with fruitless labour that food i speak the truth shall be his ruin.
text.11: he feeds no trusty friend no man to love him all guilt is he who eats with no partaker.
text.12: the ploughshare ploughing makes the food that feeds us and with its feet cuts through the path it follows.
text.13: better the speaking than the silent brahman the liberal friend outyalues him who gives not.
text.14: he with one foot hath far outrun the biped and the twofooted catches the threefooted.
text.15: fourfooted creatures come when bipeds call them and stand and look where five are met together.
text.16: the hands are both alike their labour differs the yield of sister milchkine is unequal.
text.17: twins even diffier in their strength and vigour two even kinsmen differ in their bounty.
